channel.title: IE6 Compatibility Help
channel.description:
Alright, so I have a client that uses IE6 at his workplace still and requires compatibility. It works in every other browser, is validated for both CSS and xHTML. I did not use any crazy hacks to get it to work, etc. This is what it does: http://i257.photobucket.com/albums/hh227/pwnds0/HeadshotFlyOff_080923_0900LT.gif That portrait is supposed to be next to the header/logo. I'm going to be minimal about the code, since this was paid for. [code]
....
...... [/code] So, there's the code for the header. CSS: [code] #container { width: 865px; margin: 0 auto; } #portrait { background... width: 128px; height: 171px; float: left; } #header { background .. margin-left:.... } [/code] I think I might know what's wrong, but I can't test it currently since my host is being a piece of shit.

item.title: IE6 Compatibility Help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:5, topic:232790”]float: right for #header?[/quote]I was thinking of exactly that, but I have to wait to hear a response from him.

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:6, topic:232790”][quote author=JV link=topic=307004.msg2455474#msg2455474 date=1222205619]

60% of the browser market share still lies in IE6. It’s the browser that came standard with most XP machines, and XP is the most popular OS out.

Yeah, it’s not ideal, but that’s why you still have to cater for IE6’s needs.
[/quote]
What are you talking about? Most of the computers come with Vista now - which does not have IE6. Damn, hate people who can’t be flexible and they think they’ll still make money.[/quote]Sorta/Kinda true. Even if ‘most’ computers come out with vista now, that does not mean a majority of the existing computers don’t have XP on them. And think of the people who switch back or, by default, choose XP over Vista?

[quote=“Cald Panda, post:7, topic:232790”]It may be a problem. I designed a website which worked well in Firefox but the sizing of some div’s in IE appear different than in FF. You may have to set a certain style id for IE.

Good luck with this.[/quote]Don’t you hate that? And thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: IE6 Compatibility Help
item.dc:creator: @Cald_Panda Cald Panda
item.description:
@Cald_Panda wrote:

It may be a problem. I designed a website which worked well in Firefox but the sizing of some div’s in IE appear different than in FF. You may have to set a certain style id for IE.

Good luck with this.

Read full topic

item.title: IE6 Compatibility Help
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“JV, post:4, topic:232790”]60% of the browser market share still lies in IE6. It’s the browser that came standard with most XP machines, and XP is the most popular OS out.

Yeah, it’s not ideal, but that’s why you still have to cater for IE6’s needs. :)[/quote]
What are you talking about? Most of the computers come with Vista now - which does not have IE6. Damn, hate people who can’t be flexible and they think they’ll still make money.

Read full topic

item.title: IE6 Compatibility Help
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Why don’t you just tell him to upgrade to IE7 or FireFox? It’s free, doesn’t take much time and won’t give much problems as IE6 and IE7 are almost the same when it comes to using it. IE6 is friggen 4 years old.

60% of the browser market share still lies in IE6. It’s the browser that came standard with most XP machines, and XP is the most popular OS out.

Yeah, it’s not ideal, but that’s why you still have to cater for IE6’s needs.

Read full topic

item.title: IE6 Compatibility Help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:2, topic:232790”]Why don’t you just tell him to upgrade to IE7 or FireFox? It’s free, doesn’t take much time and won’t give much problems as IE6 and IE7 are almost the same when it comes to using it. IE6 is friggen 4 years old.[/quote]I did. Apparently most of his userbase and his company uses IE6. He says he wants complete browser compatibility. Oh well.

Read full topic

item.title: IE6 Compatibility Help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Alright, so I have a client that uses IE6 at his workplace still and requires compatibility. It works in every other browser, is validated for both CSS and xHTML. I did not use any crazy hacks to get it to work, etc.

This is what it does: http://i257.photobucket.com/albums/hh227/pwnds0/HeadshotFlyOff_080923_0900LT.gif
That portrait is supposed to be next to the header/logo.

I’m going to be minimal about the code, since this was paid for.

<body>
    <div id="container">
        <div id="portrait">
            <img src=".....">
        </div>
        <div id="header">
             <div id="logo"></div>
             <div id="nav">
                  ....
             </div>
         </div>
         ......

So, there’s the code for the header.

CSS:

#container {
    width: 865px;
    margin: 0 auto;
}

#portrait {
    background...
    width: 128px;
    height: 171px;
    float: left;
}

#header {
    background ..
    margin-left:....
}

I think I might know what’s wrong, but I can’t test it currently since my host is being a piece of shit.

Read full topic
